Professional Experience

Web developer

2024-2025: Freelance

  • Developed and delivered websites for diverse small-scale client projects.

Frontend developer

2023: Pivdenmont

  • Engineered the frontend for a custom tool to calculate metal structure elements and select appropriate construction crane types based on load and building dimensions.
  • Developed the user interface using React and TypeScript, translating complex engineering requirements into a functional and intuitive tool.

Frontend developer

2022–2023: Startup "Time Angle"

  • Developed and implemented the frontend architecture for an investment and business project platform using Angular and TypeScript.
  • Built key features including project preview pages, user-to-administrator request systems, participant interaction modules, and real-time project chats.
  • Authored and maintained frontend services for seamless interaction with Firebase to manage project data, user authentication, and file sharing.

Frontend developer

2022: ANL "All Night Long"

  • Implemented the complete frontend in React and TypeScript for an event management company, enabling clients to order services and book tickets for concerts, festivals, and corporate events.

Frontend developer

2020–2022: "AIT", INC

  • Rapidly developed numerous websites using HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript in a high-volume production environment.
  • Contributed to the development of the company's main product, a tender monitoring platform, using React and TypeScript.

Backend developer

2019-2020: Blockchain startup "Token-tema"

  • Designed, developed, and tested a multi-level referral bonus distribution matrix using Python and Django.
  • Implemented robust, multi-factor oAuth2 authentication and other backend features for the blockchain platform.

About me

I've always been interested in the direction of IT and the development of modern new technologies.
I had already worked on several fast-growing commercial projects, which gave me a boost to develop as an IT specialist.

If you ask me what a developer's job looks like, I would tell you the following. You constantly have to generate new ideas and tasks, search for solutions, operate with abstractions, think through the architecture and composition of the system elements, implement the code, then test, change, upgrade and test it again, and then start a new iteration, repeating the whole process over and over again to achieve the goal. In my opinion, this process is the most exciting in the developer's work and for me personally it is associated with the work of a natural scientist.

Programming on Python, I came to the conclusion that almost every modern application needs a web interface. I set myself the goal to master technologies for developing web interfaces and become a specialist in this interesting field. At the moment I am passionate about frontend development and I really like it, but I also have some work experience in the backend, so in the future I would like to develop as a full-stack developer.

I am always open to acquiring new knowledge and skills and improving existing ones.
